channel.title: Tracker off roading
channel.description:
So, me and a buddy were driving around talking about how bored we are, and he says its time we start on this off road deal, we have been wanting to get a vehicle or make one, well found out a friend had a running 93 geo tracker in his back yard, not bad at 480$.
So weve got this crashed tracker, runs fine, needs an alternator, belt, and some brake work. Nothing major, no hood or driver side headlight lol.
end Random info i felt like throwing in.
So, we have a mad low budget, it was a cheap fucker we got just for fucking around and off roading with. Any one know anything we can do to make it better that doesn't cost an arm n leg? So far our only idea is suspension spacers or w/e. We want a winch but I doubt we can afford one, any cheap brands that work nicely? And, opinions, < $500 for a running tracker, are they worth it?

item.title: Tracker off roading
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Trust me they do the job round here where most other 4x4’s cant go

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

Land Rovers are ridiculously overpriced pieces of shit. A Jeep would be much better AND much cheaper.

Land rover discovery or defender ftw… or even a range rover

item.title: Tracker off roading
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“dragonlord, post:2, topic:269198”]go with a suzuki samurai, it will run the shit out of a tracker, and still have room to get better

to buy a sammy, it will cost more than a tracker, but all kits are cheaper[/quote]

I’m fairly confident they are identical vehicles, with different branding on them. I know the Geo Tracker was made by suzuki at least.

My advice would be not to spend much, get some nice used tires at a junk yard (make sure all 4 are the exact same size) and if you want to try to jack up the rear end you can with some $30 dollar blocks from autozone, but I believe the front end has independant suspension and therefore there is no easy or cheap way to raise it.

If you want a good, cheap winch, check out harbor freight tools (you can order online or go to a local store if there is one near you)

Read full topic
